Articles.Content: This is something that has bothered me practically since Valentina became part of the game. It is a minor issue but I need to get it out of my system. Maybe this has been discussed previously but a quick search did not get me any result so bear with me please. Quite frankly it bothers me that Valentina is by her lonesome self on the start game screen. Her facial expression also says this is kind of meh. She clearly doesn't enjoy herself. Having her seperated from Jeb, Bill and Bob who are on the mainmenu and all have slight smiles always gives me the feeling that she is some sort of ostracized loner. Like that one person who always gets bullied by the aholes in highschool. Of course this is not at all how it is represented in the rest of the game and shouldn't be. That is why I feel the disconnect is all the stronger at that point. Personally I think she should be surrounded by the boys on her screen like a welcome to the new team member. @KasperVld why did Valentina end up alone and somewhat lost looking on her own screen?

Quite possibly she was added to the home screen as an after thought and was cheap to add her on that screen without any other animation?

I mean, I do get your point, it looks as if she was abandoned by the rest of the team and it could be nicer if she is on mun, laying on a chair having sun... sort of like chilling out.

Clearly she was added after the image was already made.

Her visor doesn't even have the same yellowish tint that the others do.

However, if you are implying some sort of chauvinism on Squads part, I think you are reading into it a little bit too much. (To be perfectly frank we don't even know that Kerbal's have a gender, Just because Val has a pony tail and slightly feminine features doesn't prove she's biologically different in any meaningful way.)

Kerbals were supposed to be gender-less, but consumers identified them as male.  Thus, females were created.

Edited April 24, 2016 by klgraham1013

It's not a separate screen, its clearly a camera pan. She is just some degrees to the right. Having BBJ appear again would mean they teleported or doubled.

Graphically, having 3+1 is also nicer than 4 kerbals in one screen. And where BBJ have to share, she dominates her own menu.

And: really? I mean really? THIS is something to bother about?

Then why don't bother about one of them is upside-down? Why is DRES not on the screen, but kerbin?
Dres always gets the shaft.

You'll notice that the loading screen image has been replaced by a picure with two of the three plus Val. Don't know which of Jeb/Bill, Jeb/Bob, or Bill/Bob it is, and the only reason we know it's any of these characters in particular is because they're explicitly wearing their orange suits. Presumeably the other guy was holding the camera?

we can't comfirm the identities of any of the kerbals on the menu screen, by the way, since they're all wearing white suits!

The whole scene is actually fake and is shot in a studio. If they place Val in front of the boys the shadows would reveal that it's all fake, and if they put her on the side she'll fall through the studio backdrop. This is also why she did not have a visor initially in 1.0; an oversight that truly revealed the nature of this atrocity. Of course this was fixed but by then the secret was out.
